zone.line: [reverso]
Hasten to the bridal bed
Underneath the grave tis spread
In darkness may our love be hid—
Oblivion is our coverlid—
We may rest, & none forbid—
Clasp me, till our hearts be grown
Like two lovers', into one
Till this dreadful transport may
Like a vapour, fade away
In the sleep which lasts alway
We may dream in that long sleep
That we are not those who weep;
Even as pleasure dreams of thee
Life-deserting Misery
Thou mayest dream of her with me
Let us laugh & make our mirth
At all shadows on the Earth
As dogs bay the moonlight clouds
Which , like spectres wrapt in shrouds
Pass oer night in multitudes
